etymology.description: Pictogram: a shield with feather ornaments; alternatively linked to a bifurcated weapon related to 單; later also used as a phonetic loan/simplification for 乾 and 幹.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a plume-topped shield, though some oracle-bone forms may instead show a forked hunting weapon akin to 單. Through later phonetic borrowing it came to write both 乾 and 幹 in the simplified system, yielding multiple readings and senses today.
etymology.simplification: Mainland reforms merged 乾 and 幹 into 干 for graphic economy and phonetic loan use, so 干 now covers 'dry' (gān) and 'trunk; to do' (gàn); traditional Chinese keeps 乾 and 幹 distinct.

examples.chinese: 这棵老松树的树干很粗(這棵老松樹的樹幹很粗)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kē lǎo sōngshù de shùgàn hěn cū.
examples.english: The trunk of this old pine is thick.

examples.chinese: 竹子的主干中空(竹子的主幹中空)。
examples.english: The main stem of bamboo is hollow.

examples.chinese: 他负责干线的维护(他負責幹線的維護)。
examples.english: He is responsible for maintaining the main line.
